It includes mechanical tools and equipment used in farming, crucial for tasks such as plowing, seeding, spraying, and harvesting.
Types of machinery include tractors, planters, harvesters, and sprayers.
The year the machinery was manufactured indicates its age and potential modernity in technology, while the model of the machinery affects its functionality and suitability for specific tasks.

Generated original text: Tractors are versatile pieces of machinery essential for multiple farming tasks, from soil preparation to crop maintenance.
Planters are machinery designed to plant seeds efficiently and accurately, crucial for optimal crop distribution and growth.
Harvesters are especially interesting as they are a specialized machinery that is used for harvesting.
Machinery used for preparation of the field for the planting includes those machines like tractors equipped with specific attachments, used to prepare the field for planting.
Machinery used for planting plays a pivotal role in the agricultural planting process.
Machinery used for harvesting includes combines, harvesters, and other equipment that is primarily utilized to collect and process crops at the end of their growing cycle.
To reduce manual work, the farmer owns machinery.
A farmer can own one or more pieces of machinery.
The machinery owned by the farmer reflects the capacity for mechanized farming, which is a significant factor in modern agricultural practices.

Owning such machinery typically enhances a farmer's ability to perform various agricultural tasks more efficiently and effectively, from soil preparation and planting to harvesting and post-harvest processing.
